page.title: 17CARSPHAIRN PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {HISTORY}Carsphairn Parish was formed in 1640 from the northern parts of Dalry and Kells.Carsphairn became a centre for Covenanters,and one of its ministers,John Semple,was summoned to Edinburgh in 1677 and threatened with dire penalties if he did not recant. {THE PRESENT}Most people are of Protestant(Church of Scotland)faith. The present church was built in 1815, replacing an earlier one destroyed by fire.The interior is effectively divided by columns into a nave and two aisles. Down the centre of the nave runs a long communion table with seats down each side, surrounded by a fence with doors at each end.Present membership of the church is around 115,but weekly congregations are seldom more than 50, and usually around 20.The church is linked with Dalry and shares a minister with them.
